project.teaser: The Mission Restore our Oceans and Waters by 2030 provides a holistic and coherent framework for developing a systemic approach to the depollution and regeneration of the basin hydrosphere, which is a striking need in the Mediterranean Sea (MED). In the BlueMissionMed...
project.objective: The Mission Restore our Oceans and Waters by 2030 provides a holistic and coherent framework for developing a systemic approach to the depollution and regeneration of the basin hydrosphere, which is a striking need in the Mediterranean Sea (MED). In the BlueMissionMed proposal, a multi-actor, trans-sectorial and multidisciplinary consortium, consisting of 6 R&I public institutions, 5 NGOs, 3 industrial associations and 2 SMEs from 5 MS and 2 AC of the MED, proposes to set up, structure and empower a MED Lighthouse supporting the development and deployment of transformative innovative technological, social, business and governance solutions for ensuring a 30-50% reduction of pollution of the basin hydrosphere by 2030. It will be an interactive multi-actors digital platform able to offer to all MED Countries/Regions and stakeholders to access the necessary knowledge and tools. It will build on, connect and structure existing initiatives and activities, including the 9 Pilot BLUEMED on plastics free healthy MED and will exploit the R&I and policy knowledge generated by the funded projects/initiatives on the MED decontamination and restoration, ultimately promoting basin-wide cooperation, commitment and deployment of solutions addressing the Mission objectives. The Lighthouse will also ensure i) coherence, alignment and monitoring of EU, national and local policies, initiatives and actions ongoing the MED basin; ii) an effective provision of technical services, governance and business models to support and guarantee a sustainable socio-economic development of the basin; iii) a well-functioning basin scale innovation ecosystem attractive towards investors and businesses, iv) the required engagement of the society at large, thanks to a robust awareness raising and citizen science approach in its implementation in the sea basin and beyond, and, thus, v) the effective deployment of Mission Implementation Charter and piloting of the Mission objectives for the MED by 2025.
project.title: Lighthouse coordinating and supporting the innovation ecosystem for a Healthy, Pollution free Mediterranean Sea

article.title: Supporting the EU Mission "Restore our Ocean and Waters by 2030"

result.title: Terms of Reference (ToRs) of and Nation/Regional Hubs
result.description: Terms of Reference (ToRs) of and Nation/Regional Hubs deliverable is aimed to Set-up and Support the network of National/Regional Hubs and to mobilize the Hubs to become “competence centres” to support the deployment of the BlueMissionMed activities. The activity is linked to Task 2.3.

result.title: Operational Implementation Roadmap
result.description: The Operational Implementation Roadmap il linked to Task 2.2 with the aim to ensure a robust planning of well-coordinated activities underpinned by a consistent monitoring framework and to contribute to the implementation of the Mission objectives through all BlueMissionMed activities.

result.title: BlueMissionMed online platform
result.description: BlueMissionMed online platform is linked to task 6.4 but carries all the project results. It collects and makes centrally available the BlueMissionMed outputs; it supports the LH online stakeholder engagement and collaborations providing online participative spaces and it also contributes to facilitate the access to knowledge and good practices (technological, social, business, governance), networks, services and tools and the access of new stakeholders.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - BlueMissionMed (Lighthouse coordinating and supporting the innovation ecosystem for a Healthy, Pollution free Mediterranean Sea)
result.teaser: The BlueMissionMed CSA proposes to set up, structure and empower a Mediterranean Sea (MED) Lighthouse (LH) supporting the development and deployment of transformative innovative technological, social, business and governance solutions for ensuring a 30-50% reduction of...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

webItem.alternativeText: BlueMissionMed Path to Deploy Innovative Transformative Solutions

result.title: Book for kids “Our blue treasure”
result.description: "Book for kids “Our blue treasure” is linked to task 6.3 and represents one of the activities tailored to emotionally inspire, inform and activate the target audiences identified, in this case the youngest generations.The book for kids will be designed and produced by BlueMissionMed to raise awareness and inform children (age 6-10) about the value of the Oceans for the planet with a special focus on Mission Ocean themes. The book will be based on scientific literature and translated in a simple, attractive and stimulating language to communicate with the youngest audience.The book “Our blue treasure” will be inspired by the book ""what's bioeconomy"" that was co-designed by one of the BlueMissionMed partners (FVA) in the context of the Horizon2020 BIOVOICES project."

result.title: Portfolio of selected innovative transformative solutions
result.description: A portfolio of selected innovative transformative solutions is delivered in relation to task 3.3 activities.

result.title: Data and Ethics Management Plan
result.description: To ensure compliance to the EU regulations the Data and Ethics Management Plan Deliverable (D1.1) is associated to Task 1.2.

result.title: Report of the activities of the three BlueMissionMed Governing Bodies
result.description: To ensure an effective BlueMissionMed governance structure and monitoring T1.5 activities will be reported in D.1.4. An update of the WP is foreseen at M24

result.title: Sustainability and Exploitation Plan
result.description: Sustainability and Exploitation Plan is associated to task 5.5 activities and will produce sustainability plan of the LH with a set of policy briefs towards the ‘deployment and upscaling phase’ of the Mission.

result.title: Communication, Dissemination and Outreach strategy
result.description: Communication, Dissemination and Outreach strategy is linked to task 6.1 and is aimed to maximise the project’s outcomes by strategically planning effective and targeted Communication, Dissemination and Outreach activities

result.title: LH stakeholder engagement and Ecosystem Enablers report (including databases)
result.description: LH stakeholder engagement and Ecosystem Enablers report (including databases) is delivered at M18 and updated at M36.It is linked to task 2.5 with the aim to identify and mobilise the most suitable players to act as “LH Ecosystem Enablers” and building on existing networks and initiatives (e.g. Industrial Associations, NGOs, foundations, Civil Society Organisations, Associations of Majors, Regions, Young associations, Business and Financial actors, Maritime technology clusters, Incubators, business support organisation, etc).

result.title: Terms of Reference (ToR) of Mediterranean Sea basin LH
result.description: D2.1 Terms of Reference (ToR) of Mediterranean Sea basin LH is associated to Task 2.1 and respond to the objectives of co-create the participative Mediterranean sea basin LH Terms of Reference (ToR), building on previous experiences and to guide all BlueMissionMed activities and ensure interoperability with the Mission Implementation Platform and other open source platforms to maximise the exploitation of the BlueMissionMed outputs

result.title: Management and implementation booklet, including quality and risk management plan
result.description: Management and implementation booklet, including quality and risk management plan (D1.1) is associated to T1.1 with the aim to allow:- that the project coordination and support activities to be carried out according to the work plan, also by monitoring and ensuring quality and timing of project deliverables;- to carry out the financial and administrative management and reporting of the project monitoring; - to resolve possible risks and activate appropriate mitigation measure and- to manage contacts with the EU Commission and establish effective internal and external communication.

result.title: Report on opportunities, enabling factors, gaps, barriers, resistances and needs
result.description: A report on opportunities, enabling factors, gaps, barriers, resistances and needs is delivered in relation to Task 3.4 activities:- to frame gaps (including R&I needs at basin level), barriers & resistances (e.g. innovation readiness, cultural, economic, regulatory framework, etc) and needs for the implementation of the innovative solutions identified in the 35 innovative transformative solutions; - to provide recommendations to the pathway for implementation; - to provide requirements and needs in terms of capacity and support for the design of WP4 catalogue of services

result.title: Catalogue of projects and Initiatives
result.description: Catalogue of projects and Initiatives is delivered at M12 and updated at M36.It is linked to task 3.1 to develop, make publicly available and curate a catalogue of projects and initiatives funded at EU, national and regional level (e.g. Horizon2020, Interreg, LIFE, PRIMA, ENI CBC MED, the Switchers, etc.) including selected privately funded initiatives and projects, building on previous mapping of projects results.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
